line.en: 'Sorry, I'll have to pass for today.'
'OK, I understand.'
Ageha didn't really try to pursue it.
'Kotori, why don't we go part of the way\ntogether?'
'Sure.'
The two of them leave the classroom together.
I see them off, then head to the first grade\nclassrooms.
'Where is Asa's classroom?'
I look around while walking down the hallway\nwhere the first grade classrooms are.
I just kind of casually decided to come here, but\nmaybe I'm a little out of place.
'Oh, here it is.'
Umm, where's Asa...
Ah, there she is.
'Hey, Asa.'

'I think you've already heard but we're taking a
day off from club activities today, so if you're
free, I thought we could head back together. So,
how about it?'
Asa isn't responding to me at all.
'What's up? Don't you feel well?'
'...Geez. You suddenly come into a first grade\nclassroom, then start to flirt with the girls.\nYou really are unbelievable.'
Huh?
'To begin with, you've got the wrong person.'
Huh? This isn't Asa...
'Oh, Aoi. What are you doing here?'
'Asa?'
Asa pokes her head out from the classroom, then\nruns over to me.
Which means this is...?
'That one's the real one, and this one's a fake?'
'Who are you calling a fake?'
'I'm Yoru. How can you get us mixed up when we're\ntogether so often?'
'But this is Asa's desk...'
'Yoru came here because we were planning to go\nback together, but I had to go to the staff room,\nso she waited here for me.'
'So that's the situation.'
I see. That's why she's here.
'So, you came to this first grade classroom to\nflirt with my sister.'
'I'm not flirting. I thought that since we live\nin the same dormitory, and are in the same club,\nif we've got free time,'
'It's not a club, it's a society.'
'Grrrr. It may seem like that on the surface, but\nto me, it's a club!'
'Geez, how lame.'
I at least want to think of it as a club.
If we don't do that, we won't be able to have it\nrestored as a club.
The Soaring Club has been shut down, but Amane\nfought so desperately to protect it.
We will make it a club once again.
'You look like you're thinking about something\nthat's probably a total hassle.'
'No, I'm just enjoying my youth.'
'So lame...'
'OK, OK, do you want to go back with us, Aoi?\nIt's fine by me.'
'Oh, really?'
'Wait, sis! What am I supposed to do!?'
'Well, why don't you come with us?'
'No way, I don't wanna go with him!'
'Whaaaat? Aoi's a good guy! If that's how you\nfeel, why don't you go home separately?'
'Uh! Sis, are you choosing him over me?'
'So, in the end, you decided to come with us?'
'I had no choice! Also, I would be scared that he\nmight try something if I left the two of you\ntogether!'
'Try something? Ah. Umm... Aoi, you wouldn't...'
'Hey, what are you blushing for, Asa? I wouldn't\ndo anything like that!'
'I wonder. You're the type of senior student who\nintrudes in his junior's class and starts\nflirting with the girls.'
'I told you, that's not what I was thinking when\nI came into the classroom. I just want to get to\nknow Asa, that's all.'
'In most countries, that's generally considered\nto be flirting.'
'I've... been flirted with...?'
I never intended to flirt with her.
But, I guess that to those around us, that it\nmight seem that way...
'The worst ones are those who lack\nself-awareness.'
'I think that Aoi's great. He doesn't hesitate to\nmeet people halfway, and is good at closing the\ndistance between himself and others.'
'But you really are something.'
'What do you mean?'
'You transferred here, then you suddenly started\ngetting along with Kotori. You also got close to\nMochizuki-senpai, right?'
The worst ones are those who lack self-awareness.
It's true that at that time, I didn't really take\nin the things that people said to me...
'Well, in your case, you're completely tactless,\nso you simply don't make any distinction between\nboys and girls when you spend time with them.'
'Ah. Oh. Yeah, I guess not.'
'As a girl, that kind of thing is really\nirritating.'
'So what should I do?'
'I'm just telling you to keep your hands off my\nsister.'
'Hey, Yoru. He hasn't done anything like that\nyet.'
'Asa, don't you think that sounds like I will at\nsome point?'
'If it was Aoi... I wouldn't...'
'...Stare'
What is with this frosty vibe!
'A...anyway, what shall we do now?'
'What do you mean? You're the one who brought us\nwith you.'
'Y...yeah... OK, well for now, let's just go\nshopping!'
'I... don't mind what we do! If I'm with you,\nAoi, I'm sure it'll be fun!'
'Thanks, Asa.'
Asa really is a nice girl. Not like her sister...
'Hmph. She's a good girl, not like me.'
'What are you, telepathic?'
'Oh, Aoi! It's a pet shop! There's a cute\ndoggie!'
Asa stopped all of a sudden, then dashed into the\npet shop, like it was drawing her in.
It seems she'd spotted a dog in a cage at the\nfront of the store.
'Wow, it's so cute!'
'Does Asa like dogs?'
'She loves dogs. Even though they're dangerous\nanimals.'
'Dangerous...?'

'If you get close to dogs, they bark at you, if
you let your guard down, they bite you. You'd
have to be crazy to keep a ferocious animal like
that as a pet.'
'I think that your ideas about dogs are crazy.'
Could it be that she's scared of them...?
'Hmph!'
'Yay, yay! Here, here!'
Asa continues to play with the dog at the front\nof the store.
It's quite adorable.
'Oh, a cat!'
Yoru, who was scared of dogs until just now, saw\na cat in a cage inside the store, and tottered\nover to it.
So she's scared of dogs, but likes cats.
'Ooooh! Here kitty, kitty! Meow, meow!'
Hmm. As expected of twins.
Looks like when they see cute animals, they lose\nsight of everything else around them.
'Here, here, I'll play with you! OK, lift up your\npaw. Yes, like that... why did you stop?'
'See, like my hand! Yes, lift your paw... Aww...\nwhy do you stop and pull it back halfway?'
'OK, sit! Yay! See, you can sit! Ok, one more\ntime. Lift your paw. Yes, this way, this way...'
'A little more, a little more... Aaaah! That's\nnot it! Don't scratch your head! Hold my hand!\nHere! This way! Aaaaah!'
'Asa, you're not playing with the dog, the dog's\nplaying with you.'
'Sniff, sniff...'
'Hold out your paw!'
'Meow! (The cat holds out its paw to Yoru's\nhand)'
'Even though it's a cat, it still did it?'
'Yoru really is great, isn't she?'
'Today was really fun, Aoi.'
After that, we wandered around the town, then\nwent down to the underground level.
While chatting, we hung out in the stores, to\nkeep cool.

So this is window shopping? It might be kind of
annoying for the shopkeepers, but I hope they'll
let us off, since we're just students and don't
have much money.
No one said anything, but we found ourselves\nheading back to Flying Fish Manor. Then...
'Ah!'
Once again, Asa suddenly stopped, in the street.
'Ah! There! Look, Aoi!'
'Hmm?'
The thing that Asa was pointing at was a sign in\nfront of a stall called 'Super Spicy Habanero\nKebab'.
It somehow seemed like a kind of ominous food\nstall...
'Spicy things again, sis? You really like them,\ndon't you?'
'Asa, you like spicy things?'
'I...I'm just gonna go and buy one!'
Without answering my question, she rushed over to\nthe stall as fast as she could.
She really is the type who loses sight of\neverything when she sees something she likes.
'Don't you want one too?'
'I hate spicy things. Why don't you go and get\none?'
'No, I'm OK. It looks like the kind of thing\nthat'll give you stomachache.'
'What a wimp.'
'I'd prefer it if you called me cautious.'
I don't want to make myself sick to make some\nstupid point.
'Including the things at the pet shop, you two\nhave totally different tastes, despite being\ntwins.'
'It would be pretty lame if we did everything the\nsame, like eating the same food, just because\nwe're twins.'
'Yeah, that's true, but...'

'It's always been like this. Her and I are
complete opposites. The things we like, the
things we hate. Even though our appearance is
identical.'
'She likes dogs. I like cats. She likes spicy\nthings. I like sweet things. She's OK with bugs.\nI hate bugs.'
'Wow... That's interesting. You really are\ntotally different'
'...Yes. I think that's why I like her so much.'
'No, it's nothing!'
Yoru suddenly gets mad.
But is she really angry, or is she just lashing\nout?
She likes her sister this much, so does she think\nthat I'm going to take her away from her?
'What is it?'
'A crepe shop... I'll be right back.'
'Since I forced you to come with us, how about I\ntreat you?'
'I chose to come along because of your\n'flirting', didn't I? It's fine, I can buy it\nmyself.'
she said as she dashed towards the crepe shop.
Why was she smiling?
'I'm back!'
Asa came back as if she were changing places with\nYoru.
'Huh? Isn't Yoru here?'
'Just now, she went to buy a crepe, like she was\nchanging places with you.'
'Oh, is that so? What a shame. I bought one for\nYoru too.'
'Oh, yeah. Could you eat Yoru's share? If Yoru\nwent to buy a crepe, she won't need it, will\nshe?'
As she said that, Asa held out a crazy-looking\nkebab, and the filling in the middle was red.
When she held it out to me, the distinctive,\nspicy smell of stimulants assaulted my nose.
'Hey, hold on, that's...'
'Go ahead! You're a boy, so you could eat two of\nthese!'
'I recommend it!'
Every time she waves it, the smell going up my\nnostrils makes me sweat.
Th...this is...
'Asa, why don't you...'
'I bought three for myself, so I'm OK.'
'Asa, you're a big eater!?'
'I have an extra stomach just for spicy things!'
In the end I gave in and ate it. Even though we\nwere going to have dinner afterwards...
Needless to say, that evening, I had agonizing\nstomach pains.
